text: If I had to say which Metal Gear Solid was my favourite, I would easily choose MGS3 without a doubt! It had such an incredible theme song AND it had "Snake Eater" which was just as fantastic if not better! And the unforgettable characters and thoroughly enjoyable gameplay.. If I had a list of games I could never forget, Snake Eater would definitely fit on that list.

text: I like hearing how the metal gear solid main theme evolved during the years with each installment. I always watched the opening sequence of MGS 2 just to hear its theme and I was stunned every time. That is however until MGS 3 came out... I think that this might even be the best version, the moment when this theme starts playing when you are battling Volgin on top of the Shegohad and when you finally beat the game and final moments come... It was simply epic.

text: Great multiphase theme for a great game. My favorite game in the series is still the first MGS, but I know a lot of people's favorite is MGS3. But then again, a lot of people's favorite is also #2 or #4, which proves how each iteration maintains the series' known high standards. Ground Zeroes had my curiosity, but now MGS5 has my attention.
author: SupraDarky

text:
For me 4 > 3 > 2 > 1. Â I feel like saying they're all practically equal, but in reality I probably consider 3 and 4 to be a good step ahead of 1.

I was kinda disappointed in the original game though.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text:
I have to say, I'm a bit disappointed in your choices for MGS music so far.

Sure, Gregson-William's themes are great and all, but so clichÃ© by now... There are plenty of in-game themes which are less famous, but much more original and varied.

Take "Rescue Emma" from MGS2, "Rex Lair" from MGS1, or even the alert themes from GZ (which were obviously scored by Ludvig Forssell even if Gregson-Williams is credited)... It's really something else.

Military-themed Hollywood-style music is fine. But there is so much more to MGS than this.
author: flyingfoxxx1984

text:
Since my last message I replayed MGS1 and had a blast, and decided that in retrospect MGS3 is my favorite, but I think I still like 4 more than 1. Â 2 is my least favorite now but it isn't far behind the other three TBH.

Haven't played MGSV and not really in a mood to remedy that anytime soon.
author: LinkMarioSamus
